answer.explanation:
Transript:
W: Hi, Mr. Joyce. This is Sally Walker calling from Frohman Publishing. Q1 My company has a three-page text that we need translated into Chinese. I know you sometimes do these kinds of short-term jobs for our company.
M: Yeah, I would be happy to. Q2 However, you should know that it is my policy to be paid in advance. Is that OK?
W: That's no problem. I’ll transfer the money into your bank account immediately. Q3 The deadline for this translation hasn’t been decided yet. Once I know, I will inform you.
M: Thank you for your understanding. Please e-mail me the document. I'll do my best.

question.text: Why is the woman calling?
What does the man ask the woman to do?
What will the woman inform the man about?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, James. This is Candice in the marketing department. Q1 I'm supposed to be leading a weekly meeting in room 302 soon, but I just discovered that the room is already in use.
M: I’m sorry, Candice. Actually, I have been getting calls like this all day. Q2 It looks like an error with our computer system is to blame for the mix-up.
W: Oh, I see. Well, is there a currently vacant room that I could use for the meeting? The room will need to be equipped with a computer and a projector.
M: I’ll need to check manually to determine which room will be available. Q3 I’ll let you know as soon as I find another suitable room. Please wait for a moment.

question.text: What is the woman’s problem?
choices: (B) A piece of equipment is out of stock.

question.text: Why does the man mention a system malfunction?
choices: (A) To apologize for an incorrect charge

question.text: What does the man say he will do?

answer.explanation:
M: Hello. Q1 Last Thursday, I arranged to have cable television installed at my house this Wednesday. Unfortunately, I will have to be out of town that day because of some urgent matters and would like to reschedule the appointment for Friday afternoon.
W: OK, that shouldn’t be a problem. Q2 However, I would like to warn you that there is a $5 rescheduling fee. That’s our company’s policy. Can I have your name, please?
M: Oh, I see. My name is Charlie Kramer. I’m living in Hainesville. Do you know when I will have to pay this fee?
W: Q3 I’ll e-mail you soon about a user name and temporary password that you can use on our website. Please check the e-mail and pay all your bills through our website.

question.text: What did the man recently do?
Why must the man pay a fee?
choices: (A) He wants to change his schedule.

answer.text: (A) He wants to change his schedule.

question.text: What will the woman include in an e-mail?

answer.explanation:
M: Q1 Ms. Potter, the package that you sent to the advertising agency in Tokyo was returned today. It seems that you sent it to the wrong address.
W: Q2 Actually, I received an e-mail from the Tokyo office today informing me that they relocated their office yesterday. I wish they had told me earlier.
M: Well, that’s unfortunate. It seems unfair that you had to pay for the postage. It must have been expensive to send such a large package.
W: Yes, it was. Q3 I’m going to request that the company in Tokyo pay me back.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What problem does the woman mention?
choices: (A) The address is no longer relevant.

answer.text: (A) The address is no longer relevant.

question.text: What does the woman say she will do?

answer.explanation:
Transript:
W: Good morning, James. Q1 Here is a copy of your expense report from last month’s business trip to Tokyo.
M: Thanks, Mary. Q2 Oh, while you’re here, can you leave a message in this get-well-soon card for Bryce? He had knee surgery yesterday and I was thinking this card might cheer him up.
W: Oh, did he? I didn't even know he was in the hospital. I was out of town yesterday. Is it serious?
M: Not that I know of. But he said he had to stay in the hospital for a few days. Q3 I’m planning on visiting him this evening after work.

question.text: What did the woman make a copy of?
What does the man ask the woman to do?
choices: (D) Go on a business trip to Tokyo

question.text: What does the man plan to do?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, Craig. Q1 I was expecting you to submit the market analysis report yesterday, but I still haven’t received it. Do you need more time to work on it?
M: Hi, Ms. Watson. I’m really sorry I didn’t send it to you by the determined deadline. I have recently been very busy with another urgent task. Q2 I’ll make sure I finish the report before doing anything else. Is that OK?
W: Q3 Well, I really need that document for a meeting with a potential client tomorrow morning. I’ll stop by later today and help you so that we can finish it in time.

question.text: What does the woman ask the man about?
choices: (C) How to reserve a meeting room
(D) Whether a client has been contacted

question.text: What does the man say he will do?
What does the woman need?

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Tiffany. Do you know what happened to the company car? I tried to reserve it today, but I was told it’s being repaired.
W: Q1 When Mark was driving yesterday, he got a flat tire. I just heard that the car should be out of the repair shop by this evening. I'll let you know when they call me.
M: Oh, that’s good news. Q2 I was worried because I need it tomorrow morning to pick up an important client from the airport.
W: Ah, isn’t that Mr. Lee from Beijing? Q3 Just in case, why don’t you call a local car rental business and reserve a car for tomorrow? If the company car is fixed in time, you can cancel.

question.text: What does the woman say caused the problem?
choices: (D) A tire needed to be replaced.

answer.text: (D) A tire needed to be replaced.

question.text: Why is the man concerned?
choices: (B) He needs a car to greet a client.
(C) He has to reschedule a meeting.
(D) He was unable to contact a client.

answer.text: (B) He needs a car to greet a client.

question.text: What does the woman suggest?

answer.explanation:
M: This is Mike Judge, your host for the morning news here at QQBC 99.5. Today our guest is business leader Karen Chambers. Q1 She recently opened a chain of health food stores across the state. How did you get the idea, Ms. Chambers?
W: Well, I majored in food and nutrition and I minored in business administration. Q2 So, my goal was to utilize what I learned in college to open a successful company.
M: Ah, I see. What factor do you think has contributed most to the success of your chain of stores?
W: Q3 I think it’s due to the recent trend of people showing enormous interest in health and fitness.

question.text: Who most likely is the woman?
What did the woman want to do?
According to the woman, what is the main reason for her success?

answer.explanation:
Transript:
W: Q1 I need to talk to you about the interior decorations we are carrying out at the Carleton’s property. They are a major client, so we need to make sure that they are completely satisfied. Have you consulted with them about the furniture for the master bedroom?
M: I have. They agreed on all of our plans except for the choice for the master bed. Q2 They’re worried it is too big and will occupy too much space, so I’m looking for something smaller that still fits the color scheme of the room.
W: OK. Q3 I was planning on ordering all the furniture today, but I think we’ll have to wait until we get their permission.

question.text: What field do the speakers work in?
What does the man plan to do?
According to the woman, why will the speakers have to wait?
choices: (B) A contract has not been signed yet.
(D) Some equipment is out of order.

answer.explanation:
W: Hello. Q1 I’m interested in enrolling in your school’s vocational training program to become a dental assistant, but I couldn’t find any information about tuition on your website.
M: Thank you for your interest. We offer a two- semester training program to become a dental assistant at our community college. Tuition for a single semester is $6,500.
W: Oh, I see. Honestly, that is a little more than I expected. Q2 I will have to ask my bank about the possibility of getting a student loan. Is there anything else you can tell me?
M: Q3 Well, one thing to keep in mind is that our community college offers night classes for all our programs. This is very good for students who work during the day. And please remember that we are one of the top-ranked schools in the state, and so far more than 5,000 of our graduates have become dental assistants.
